usefulItems: baking dish (approx. 22 cm x 30 cm), oven
title: Cardamom Bread and Butter Pudding

ingredients.content: 50 g butter, soft, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place pistachios in mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a small bowl.
Place small bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in sultanas. Set bowl aside.

Place milk, sugar and ground cardamom in mixing bowl then heat <b>5 min/80°C/speed 2<b>. Meanwhile, grease a baking dish (approx. 22 cm x 30 cm) and spread butter on bread then cut in half diagonally, creating triangles.
Arrange bread in overlapping layers in greased baking dish, scattering reserved sultanas and chopped pistachios between layers of bread.

Add cream and eggs to infused milk then heat <b>2 min/80°C/speed 2<b>. Pour over bread in dish, pressing down to ensure all bread is coated in egg mixture, then leave to soak for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.
Bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) until custard is set and top is crunchy. Serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: Use different dried fruits such as roughly chopped apricots or mixed fruit pieces instead of sultanas.
Sometimes you just want a dessert that’s hearty and warming, which makes this one an excellent option. It has a lovely crunchy topping, and is wonderful served with vanilla or spice-infused custard.
